techniques.comment: LilacSquid operated by using compromised RDP credentials or by exploiting vulnerabilities in web applications for execution.
After gaining access through compromised RDP credentials or a vulnerable web application, LilacSquid persisted in the victim system.
LilacSquid used the bitsadmin utility to download and execute the MeshAgent. Also, used the command-line interface to create and execute services on endpoint.
PurpleInk implant is capable of gathering system information about the infected host using WMI queries.
PurpleInk implant can enumerate a given directory to obtain underlying directory names, file names and file sizes.
LilacSquid deployed InkLoader, a malware loader, to persist across reboots.
PurpleInk can read a file specified by the C2 and exfiltrate its contents.
MeshAgent was observed to manage files on the system and providing capabilities such as viewing and controlling desktop, and viewing software and hardware information about the device.
